other_tests.findings: Coagulation workup positive for elevated serum homocysteine level of 63.6 /H9262M/liter (normal level, 4 to 12 /H9262M/liter), consistent with moderate homocystinuria.
Failed toe transfer showed microthrombi within the lumen of numerous arterioles; abnormal narrowing of the lumen and fibrosis of the intima and media, demonstrating signs of early atherosclerosis.
Vitamin B6, vitamin B12, and folate levels checked; child and father screened for cystathionine-B-synthase deficiency.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Both the child and his father were treated with vitamin B6 and folate, responding with complete normalization of their serum homocysteine levels.
